tool.name: Selenzyme
tool.description: Performs enzyme selection from a reaction query

param.name: nb_ids
param.label: Number of uniprot IDs with top score to keep

param.name: nb_targets
param.label: Number of targets to display in results

param.name: direction
param.label: Use similiarity values for preferred reaction direction only

param.name: taxonIDs
param.label: Comma separated taxon ids (first considered as the host)

tool.help:
usage: selenzy-wrapper [-h] [--log ARG] [--log_file LOG_FILE] [--silent] [--version] [--nb_targets NB_TARGETS] [--d D] [--NoMSA] [--smarts] [--host HOST] pathway_file outfile
rpSBML wrapper for selenzy tool
positional arguments: pathway_file path to pathway file outfile specify output file
optional arguments: -h, --help show this help message and exit --log ARG, -l ARG Adds a console logger for the specified level (default: error) --log_file LOG_FILE Filename where to put logs --silent, -s run selenzy-wrapper silently --version show the version number and exit --nb_targets NB_TARGETS Number of targets to display in results [default = 20] --d D Use similiarity values for preferred reaction direction only [default=0 (OFF)] --NoMSA Do not compute MSA/conservation scores --host HOST Comma separated taxon ids [default: E. coli]
